required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Bexarotene in Inducing Susceptibility to Chemotherapy in Metastatic TNBC
clinical_study.official_title: Metastatic Triple-Negative Taxane-Resistant Breast Cancer: Investigating the Role of Bexarotene in Inducing Susceptibility to Chemotherapy by Differentiating Cancer Cells From a Mesenchymal-Like to an Epithelial-Like Phenotype

brief_summary.textblock:
Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) is biologically aggressive and has limited systemic treatment options, often compounded by treatment resistance.
Cell state transitions, e.g. epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) govern cancer cell behaviour.
The investigators hypothesize that by inducing change in cell state change, TNBC cells that have manifested taxane-resistance will be more sensitized to subsequent chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first biopsy before the start of treatment, to disease progression, up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: To characterize the changes in tumour transcriptome upon treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Tumour protein profile by multiplex immunohistochemistry
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first biopsy before the start of study treatment, to disease progression, up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: To characterize the changes in tumour protein profile upon treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidences of treatment related adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of start of study treatment, to 28 days after last dose of study treatment, up to 2 years

intervention.description: Administered orally once a day. Starting dosage: 200mg/m^2
Administered orally twice a day. Dosage: 1000mg/m^2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with histologically or cytologically proven metastatic TNBC
- Patients whose TNBC has progressed after prior taxane therapy in the metastatic setting, and have not received Capecitabine or 5-fluorouracil
- Females aged 21 years and older
- ECOG performance status 0 or 1
- Life expectancy greater than three months
- Patients have normal organ and marrow function
- Site(s) of disease amenable to serial bedside biopsies before, during and after study treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous palliative radiotherapy to potentially biopsy-able lesion
- Active symptomatic central nervous system (CNS) metastases
- Spinal cord compression not definitively treated with surgery and/or radiation
- Uncontrolled pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, ascites requiring recurrent drainage procedures
